New Records: Rilee Rossouw became the first South African batter to score a ton in T20 World Cup and overall the 10th player in the world.
Rilee Rossouw equalled David Miller's record becoming second South African batter to have two centuries in his name in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Rilee Rossouw and Quinton de Kock stitched a 168-run stand off just 85 balls to help South Africa get to a score of 205 runs.
Rilee Rossouw smashed consecutive century in T20Is, becoming only the second batters in the history to do so.
Post-Match Reflections: Rossouw and de Kock now hope that the bowlers can restrict the Bangladesh batters to a low score and lead the side to a big win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa made a statement as the two left-hander Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw came out with positive intent and smashed all the Bangladesh bowlers around.
Others: Rilee Rossouw returned to the South African setup in July after a gap of six years, has been in sensational form since his comeback.
